channel.title: Installer
channel.description:
[B][U]Download the newest version [URL=http://rune-shiver.com/installer/installer.zip]here[/URL]![/U][/B]
While programming my soon-to-be-done iphone application, I thought of something. Cydia. Cydia is an application on the iPhone created by Saurik, aka Jay Freeman. This application parses XML files, via the web, and downloads packages and package information, and allows you to install these packages. I thought, why not the RSPS community?
So I've created an application called "Installer".
What does it do? This application will parse an XML file full of URLs to even more XML files. Each XML file is a package. It will then process these files and grab information from them, for example the URL to the download.
An example XML file would be: [code] <package> <name>Shard Revolutions</name> <dlname>shard.zip</dlname> <download>http://rune-shiver.com/installer/packages/shard/shard.zip</download> <info>Shared Revolutions - Standard Edition. http://www.google.org/showthread.php?t=100621</info> </package> [/code] What does this mean for the community? How can it help ME? This can help you by having instant access to any private server, anytime, anywhere.
How can I get my server in the repository? Simply post your server's download link here, in this format: [code] Server Name: Download link: Information (Features etc): Version: [/code]
[IMG]http://img21.imageshack.us/img21/6556/installer3.png[/img] [img]http://img8.imageshack.us/img8/4706/installer2.png[/img] [IMG]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v201/YDoUCare/installer4.png[/img] [IMG]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v201/YDoUCare/installer5.png[/img]
All applications are extracted to the "packages" folder.
Currently has 12 sources in the repository, and growing.

item.dc:creator: @Jamie1200 Jamie1200
item.description:
@Jamie1200 wrote:

[quote=“shiver_, post:18, topic:266148”][quote author=Jamie1200 link=topic=351409.msg2698722#msg2698722 date=1236453387]
I,m Not Sure About This, But Should’nt You Have Asked The Owners Of The Source If Was OK To Use In This Tool? Otherwise Won’t It Count As Leeching?
[/quote]

Ignorant statement…[/quote]

Sorry, But i am moderated, and posts I make are reveiwed by a moderator, the post coludn’t have been all that bad, besides that I was asking a question, a simple yes or no would have been better.
if you have a problem with my posting please take it to PMs not here, thats all i am saying on the matter

Read full topic

item.title: Installer
item.dc:creator: @shiver1 shiver_
item.description:
@shiver1 wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:13, topic:266148”]All I read was:
[tt]Shard Revolutions is based on BlakeScape[/tt]

I stopped there.[/quote]

That is what is inside the thread on r-s. Don’t judge what the program does based upon the content inside the repository. I expected more from someone like yourself.

Just like Taharok's old tool. Looks nice, well done Smiley.

Just one thing, how did you manage to make the “send feedback” link in the title bar?

That’s not for this, I’m running Windows 7, which wants feedback.

Read full topic

item.title: Installer
item.dc:creator: @shiver1 shiver_
item.description:
@shiver1 wrote:

[quote=“Kihomura, post:10, topic:266148”][quote author=originalpker link=topic=351409.msg2698177#msg2698177 date=1236418842]
Nice job, no virus’s or anything.

Originalpker~
[/quote]

I did not know you could scan Java applications for viruses.[/quote]

Well assuming he knows what he’s doing, he decompiled it, and searched for anything suspicious.
Actually, if you want to check for a botnet, you can use reflection to check for objects that connect via HTTP, or via a Socket.

item.title: Installer
item.dc:creator: @shiver1 shiver_
item.description:
@shiver1 wrote:

Download the newest version here!

While programming my soon-to-be-done iphone application, I thought of something. Cydia. Cydia is an application on the iPhone created by Saurik, aka Jay Freeman. This application parses XML files, via the web, and downloads packages and package information, and allows you to install these packages. I thought, why not the RSPS community?

So I’ve created an application called “Installer”.

What does it do?
This application will parse an XML file full of URLs to even more XML files. Each XML file is a package. It will then process these files and grab information from them, for example the URL to the download.

An example XML file would be:

<package>
<name>Shard Revolutions</name>
<dlname>shard.zip</dlname>
<download>http://rune-shiver.com/installer/packages/shard/shard.zip</download>
<info>Shared Revolutions - Standard Edition.
http://www.google.org/showthread.php?t=100621</info>
</package>

What does this mean for the community? How can it help ME?
This can help you by having instant access to any private server, anytime, anywhere.

How can I get my server in the repository?
Simply post your server’s download link here, in this format:

Server Name: 
Download link: 
Information (Features etc): 
Version:

installer5.png800×470

All applications are extracted to the “packages” folder.

Currently has 12 sources in the repository, and growing.
